ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The class is difficult but excellent. At once demanding and relaxing. The pace is fast and the material is complex, but the learning atmosphere is engaging and fun.
Its a great class if you want to learn sanskrit.

You will work hard, you will learn the language thoroughly, you will not feel rushed -- and if you do, Dave will patiently work through it with you -- and you will have a lot of fun. I recommend it highly.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: If I go on to PhD work in Religious Studies, I think Sanskrit will not only be required, but extremely important in that work. So, it deepens my work by giving me access to important texts. This course has also had a profound effect upon my conception of language learning. It has been a very positive experience. A great semester.
